abstract.p: Matthew P Emmons letter on May 18 article on vacation homes

block.p: To the Editor: Re ''The Tyranny of the 2nd Home'' (May 18): I hope your article on vacation homes serves to discourage would-be homesteaders. As a native of Colorado, where formerly quaint mountain towns have morphed to a suburban sprawl of empty mansions for investment bankers who fly out for a weekend a year, I sympathize with the beleaguered double-homeowners in the article the way I sympathize with Hummer owners who are feeling the bite of high gas prices: not much. If you want to spend vacation time in the woods, buy a tent. Second homes are a blight on the land and are one of the pinnacles of American over-consumption.
